item.title: Ticket #1414 (echo newline correction in wp-includes/template-functions-post.php) created
item.dc:creator: vroteus
item.description:
First off, I'm not sure if this is a problem in 1.5.1.1 or not as I am using 1.5.1.2 which was not a choice for this ticket's properties.

WP Version: 1.5.1.2
File: wp-includes/template-functions-post.php
Line: 395
Function: _page_level_out

The output of the function is being built up in the $output varaible, but line 395 echoes a newline character rather than concatenating it onto the $output string.

item.title: Ticket #1413 (is_* functions still return true on is_404() pages) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
If you use is_single(), is_day(), is_month(), is_year() etc in your theme to show/hide things conditionally, the don't work as they should for 404 requests. So if â€‹http://site.com/2004/04/02/bad-title does not exist, is_404() will be true, but so will is_single()

If a page is 404, it can't be anything else. Even if it looks like it is formatted like a permalink page, it's not a single page. It's a 404, period. The logic should be changed so that if is_404() is true, every other "is" is false.
